review: Solid construction. It has the same build quality as the Apple TV. However, the remote might be a little bit better on the Fire TV. Layout is nice and easy to use.Only downsides:There is no Prime only section. This makes it hard for others to watch movies and know they are not at risk of buying something. Yes the Prime stripe at the corner is there but it is not large. Plus I don't want to go through every movie and keep an eye out if it's Prime or not.Second, there doesn't seem to be a reset of the device from the remote. I don't mind that it never turns off, but when I'm switching Ethernet cords around and it loses internet for a while, it freezes the unit since it's constantly searching for internet. A simple sleep/awake functions would help me with this. It's easier than unplugging and plugging the device.Overall, highly recommend this device.
author: Agent Orange Peel

review: I get most of my videos from Amazon. So Fire TV seemed like a no brainer. Setup was really easy. I plugged it into the internet, and HDMI on the TV. When I turned on power the drive immediately began updating software. That continued for a short while. Then it was ready to go. The menu is really better than the internet menu for finding videos, music and TV shows. The voice search function works beautifully (much to my surprise!). The most incredible thing about Fire TV is the speed. It starts up immediately. Once I find a movie and rent or buy, it is ready almost immediately. When I go the movie to watch it the movie starts within no more than 2 - 3 seconds. Yes, seconds. How it can be so fast I can't imagine. There is none of the buffering nonsense I used to get. There is no stutter of any kind in playback. The picture quality has been good. If you watch a lot of your content through Amazon then this is the way to go.
